name: Hardest Spies and Secret Agents: Real and Otherwise Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote 'The Spy Who Came In From The Cold'?
questions.explanation:
John Le Carre.

	This was perhaps the best known of the spy novels that were popular during the cold war days. Len Deighton wrote some others, including 'The Ipcress File'. Charteris wrote 'The Saint'.

questions.text: Richard Nixon made his reputation in the Alger Hiss case. What happened to Hiss?
questions.correct: Sent to prison after a second trial (caused by a hung jury in the first trial)
options: Tried and found guilty, but never served time in prison
Set free after the trial resulted in a hung jury
questions.explanation:
Sent to prison after a second trial (caused by a hung jury in the first trial).

	He served about four years in prison before being let out. His guilt is uncertain.

questions.text: Julius and Ethel Rosenberg were convicted of espionage. Who else was a defendant in the case?
questions.explanation:
Morton Sobell.

	Chambers was a key witness in the Alger Hiss case. Greenglass was Ethel's brother - but he wasn't exactly helpful to her. Cohn was a prosecuting attorney.

questions.text: When did Mata Hari commit her crimes?
questions.explanation:
World War I.

	Most people don't know anything about her - except that her name is synonymous with spying.

James Fenimore Cooper.

	His second novel.

questions.text: With whom is Christine Keeler associated?
questions.explanation:

questions.text: Which James Bond movie starred George Lazenby?
questions.explanation:
'On Her Majesty's Secret Service'.

	Lazenby entered briefly, before Roger Moore and many others. (The first few with Connery were the best.)

questions.text: Francis Gary Powers is a name from the days of the 'Cold War'. Who was he?
questions.correct: U.S. pilot shot down by Soviets
options: Double Agent working for the Soviets
Government office worker who smuggled information to the Soviets
questions.explanation:
U.S. pilot shot down by Soviets

	It was quite a sensation at the time.
